sense.name: a heavy armored, treaded military vehicle with guns
sense.examples: There were National Guard tanks rolling down Main Street. This gun carries the biggest tank shell used by the army today. Sally's brother was a tank driver in the armed forces. Mary said she's tired of driving her old tank around town. (figurative, a big, heavy car)

sense.name: a storage container
sense.examples: Those big storage tanks contain natural gas. John thinks his septic tank is clogged with tree roots. The green tanks on the dive boat are filled with Nitrox. (a gas mixture) Mary asked her daughter to clean out the fish tank. The Coast Guard went aboard to inspect a large tank ship. (A vessel with a huge storage container of fuel) Some of the tank cars on that freight train contain toxic chemicals. We had to replace our hot water tank.

sense.name: a quantity or volume, often of fuel
sense.examples: How much are you paying these days for a tank of gas? Mary realized she didn't have enough money on her to buy a tank of gas.

sense.name: a detention center for prisoners or drunks
sense.examples: This is the tank where they interrogate suspected terrorists. The two fraternity boys spent Saturday night in the drunk tank.

sense.name: a research institute
sense.examples: Pete works at a think tank in southern California. It's a report from one of the Washington policy tanks.

sense.name: a clothing style, no sleeves or collar
sense.examples: Shoes and shirts required, please no tanks. Mary wore her new lemon-yellow tank suit on the beach. Suzy thinks men in tank tops look uncouth.

sense.name: perform poorly, fail at something
sense.examples: Those stocks are currently in the tank. (not worth much) Their team has gone into the tank this season. (lost many games)

sense.name: a kind of electronic circuit
sense.examples: The inventor set up a tank circuit in his laboratory. A tank circuit sustains an oscillation.
